dct_title_s: Plan de l’Histoire universelle, òul’on voit les quatre Monarchies du Monde, et tous les Anciens Etats aussi bien que ceux qui subsistent aujourdhuy
dct_description_sm: Issued in his: Atlas historique, ou, nouvelle introduction à l’histoire, à la chronologie & à la géographie ancienne & moderne ..., Vol. 1 [Map 12]. -- Amsterdam, 1732-39. Final edition of Vol 1. dated 1739.

Map of eastern hemisphere surrounded by tabular text giving “country” name, chronology of its rule, coded numbers for location on map and for country of loyalty. Below the map, but within the neat line, are “Les Sept Merveilles du Monde” (Seven Wonders of the World), as seven small circular illustrations. On the inset, superimposed map (8.4 cm. diameter) entitled “AMERIQUE”, California is shown as a large, unlabeled island. Coastline of mainland missing to its north, but suggestion of northwest passage westward from Hudson Bay comes close to California, through the area labelled “N. Bretagne.”
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
